name: Questions about building something which optimizes divine damage, vampiric regen, damage reduction
author: Cornflower

posts.author: Cornflower
posts.content:
As I was tweaking my 2WM (2-weapon-weapon-master-help-needed-t2355131.html), thank you for all the help with it!, I had a few thoughts that I'm not sure if they were a stroke of genius (probably not) or just plain stupid...  Bear with me, because this is totally optimized for Blackstone and show my abysmal lack of knowledge of game mechanics, but...

On Blackstone Keep the following applies:
  • High-end bosses and mobs have too high AB/AC/damage for anyone to survive against them solo with an ordinary build. Either you use a tank+2dps, or 2 dps (and win the war off attrition) builds.
  • AC is not as important as Damage reduction and/or immunities.
  • If you have +6 vampiric on your weapons and many attacks per round, you can stay alive a bit. It's very easy to add +6 vampiric to a weapon.
  • Many high-end bosses and creatures are immune to crits.
  • Nobody is immune to Divine Damage or Magical Damage (well, almost noone).
  • You can easily add +d6 divine damage to (almost) any melee weapon.
  • You can with some luck with the RNG gods add HA to any melee weapon.
  • You can easily add +20 AB or +10 EB to (almost) any melee weapon.
  • You can easily add 2d4 to 2d12 elemental/physical damage up to three times to any melee weapon. (It's random distribution of both rolls and damage type, so you might get anything, really.)
  • Level 40 is the limit, though.
  • There are two weapons in game that give you magical damage. One Battleaxe and one Dwarven Waraxe. (You can also get it from an Elf Blade, but that requires a special subrace which have other disadvantages.)
  • You can easily equip your character with every possible wand that can be created by another character.
  • You can easily equip your character with various items that give +6 AC and +4 STR and other abilities. Maxing out two abilities is somewhat easy, but three is hard. (It requires that you find stuff like +5CHA cloak, +6STR gloves, +5STR belt and +7CON boots.)
  • You can equip your character with an armor with 25% immunity (and shield/helm with 5%). Theoretically, you can make two sets of armor+shield+helm and get 35% against piercing on one set and slashing on the other. (Don't think you need bludgeoning, really.)
Now, considering all that:

Does it make sense to ignore DevCrit/WeaponMaster and instead go for High-Charisma Axe-weilding Paladin/Barbarian or Paladin/Dwarven Defender, add divine and vampiric to weapons and go for 2-weapon fighting? (Or possibly Ranger levels to save on feats?) You want one or two Rogue/Bard levels for UMD, so you can use Wands, or you can throw in some druid/wizard which lets you use some more of the wands. (As a Paladin, you can use Cleric Wands if I remember correctly.)

Paladin/Bard/DD, Cleric/Rogue/DD, Barbarian/Paladin/Rogue? Huh? Or do I go Cleric/Monk with divine Kamas for max attacks and max vampiric regen?

Is there (of course there is, I just need to find it) such a build available somewhere? Or do we need to invent it?

Most people use DD to build tanks and WM for dps builds, but I'm still trying to figure out a build that can be OK as both. (Yes, I'm obsessed with soloing the high-level areas on Blackstone. Everyone needs a hobby...) So, before I start playing my 2WM, I wanted to run this idea by you guys. You've been patient with my weird builds and generous with your thoughts before, so once again I turn to you. With the above mention facts, what would be a nice build?

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
Some of your build ideas have alignment conflicts.  Both Paladins and Dwarven Defenders are required to be Lawful, but both Bards and Barbarians are forbidden to be Lawful.  Making a high-Charisma Dwarf is a challange, like making a high-Strength Halfling.

How about a Fighter 8 / Monk 9 / DD 23 with 15/- DR and 10 attacks per round?

posts.author: Cornflower
posts.content:
Empyre65 wrote: Some of your build ideas have alignment conflicts.  Both Paladins and Dwarven Defenders are required to be Lawful, but both Bards and Barbarians are forbidden to be Lawful.  Making a high-Charisma Dwarf is a challange, like making a high-Strength Halfling.

How about a Fighter 8 / Monk 9 / DD 23 with 15/- DR and 10 attacks per round?
I was also thinking Monk/DD, but then I only get +d6 divine on each Kama and I can't use either the Axe alternative or Divine Might. Hm. Is that a known build, or do I need to invent it? (Also, I'm allergic to dwarves, so I hope to come up with something that's not dwarven, but I guess I'll end up with a dwarf at the end...)
As for alignment, yes, Bards and Paladins don't mix, but Cleric/Paladin or Sorc/Paladin or Bard/Cleric or Barbarian/Cleric/CoT could work. In any case Good-Evil axis is easy to handle on BSK. Lawful/Chaotic not so much.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
If you want a tank & there are no alignment restrictions & Rdd isn't nerfed, then you can try Bard 8/ Rdd 10/ dd 22.
Like this one by Kail, although, you could end this on 32 Str easily.
http://world-of-greyhawk.github.io/buil ... 20964.html

If you want a weapon-master with divine dmg, you could try that one instead, 
but use the 30/18 attribute split for best dmg & ab (50AB) with a scythe & X5 criticals, it's gonna be scary.
harvester-of-souls-ftr-10-pal-5-wm-25-t ... .html#p674

Otherwise, go with Mick's dual-wilder.

Monk/DD, try the Gutsy Monk sometime, it has very good defenses that one (dexterity based) but interestingly, it also has relatively good AB as well.

I know, I didn't help at all probably...

posts.content: Using the Monk attack progression (unarmed or kama only), there are 6 attacks for the main hand, and 2 from the off hand, and 1 from Haste, and another one from Flurry of Blows, for a total of 10 attacks per round.
